channel.title: Posts on My Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on My Blog

item.title: macOS CRON
item.description: CRONTAB on macOS It’s annoying on macOS that each editing would prompt the pop up for authorization of scheduled task. .plist What is it? To load/unload a plist launchctl load ~/Library/LaunchAgents/test.plist launchctl unload ~/Library/LaunchAgents/test.plist Due to the limitations of recent macOS updates, it’s getting increasingly difficult to run a small command via shell, which is totally understandable at a security standpoint. Therefore, we need to use the Automator.app from Apple to essentially run any scripts (fixed) daily.

item.title: Filter on a per-app basis on iOS
item.description: Trouble with VPN (Loon) Though the filter rule support local and self-defined resource parser, GeoIP resolver, etc. I still came across many times where I had trouble with Loon enabled. This is one of easiest case involved, I would like certain app to follow certain policy, such as REJECT, DIRECT or proxy (added). It can be achieved as followed, where all the traffic via Facebook app will be blocked. [Rule] USER-AGENT,com.

item.title: iMessages/FaceTime logic
item.description: Problems (2 iPhones and 1 Mac): Tel. A (main, ‚úÖ iMessages) Tel. B (backup, ‚ùå iMessages) email A (login, ‚úÖ iMessages) email B (public, ‚ùå iMessages) Avoid spam text messages sync to Mac (no TEXTs from Tel. A) disable “Enable Messages in iCloud”: otherwise texts from Tel. A will be synced use iMessage on mac Check “you can be reached for messages at:” despite you disable in the last setting, iMessages can still arrive while regular text won’t.

item.title: VSCode Latex Mac
item.description: Using Latex on macOS Download MacTex (~3/4 GB with most packages included), via homebrew, support for Apple Silicon Guide I followed mostly VSCODE CONFIG LATEX (MAC), which is quite comprehensive and easy to follow. The only adjustment I need is the directory for skim location /opt/homebrew/bin/ if installed via homebrew. Also don’t delete syntex.gz file as it’s required for bi-directional jumping between VSCode and Skim. // latex "latex-workshop.view.pdf.viewer": "external", "latex-workshop.view.pdf.external.viewer.command": "/opt/homebrew/bin/displayline", "latex-workshop.

item.title: Wechat AntiDuck
item.description: There’s this annoying feature on macOS that would lower the media volume when you are on a call or Facetime which appears in Wechat, Facetime or Skype. Basically, you can’t listen to YT when you are on a call. To avoid that, Wechat-AntiDuck comes to help. Fix “No permission to open” sudo codesign --force --deep --sign - "/Applications/WeChat.app" This doesn’t work with the following warning. /Applications/WeChat.app: the codesign_allocate helper tool cannot be found or used Tried re-installing the homebrew version, no luck.

item.title: Conda Homebrew
item.description: Problems Miniforge installed via homebrew will remove all the env upon update/uninstall, discussion. Solution Specify conda env in condarc condarc example: https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/configuration/sample-condarc.html touch ~/.condarc mkdir ~/.conda-envs envs_dirs: - ~/.conda-envs

item.title: Docker M1 Mac
item.description: Yet Again, Docker macOS After using the official Docker for Mac for a while, it became clear to me that the app is not yet stable and reliable enough to be used for professional use case in the background nor user-friendly, ready-to-go like a actual desktop mac app. I toned down the setting and limiting the CPU to 2 cores with 4/3(?)GB RAM, and I also checked the box for using the new release virtualization framework in Experimental feature.

item.title: Video Stuff
item.description: Quality for video downloads Ref: https://wiki.servarr.com/sonarr/settings#qualities-defined In brief: Remux == Bluray > WEBDL > WEBRip > HDTV Summary: WEBDL: losslessly ripped from streaming like NF, AMZN, HULU or iTunes. Quality is quite good since they are not reencoded. The video (H.264 or H.265) and audio (AC3/AAC) streams are usually extracted from the iTunes or Amazon Video and remuxed into a MKV container without sacrificing quality. WEBRip: the file is often extracted using the HLS or RTMP/E protocols and remuxed from a TS, MP4 or FLV container to MKV.

item.title: Set up Aria2 and Chrome working nicely together
item.description: Install brew install aria2 YAAW, aria2 frontend for chrome Install Tampermonkey fake115, open raw link of this file fake115d.user.js, should auto redirect to Tampermonkey 115, download release, change crx to zip, drag it in Extensions in Chrome Aria2 config Help: https://developpaper.com/how-to-configure-aria2-to-download-files/ YYAW config Set the RPC like this: http://token:TOKEN@localhost:6800/jsonrpc Run aria2 in background on startup TBD Convert rmvb to mp4 See: https://gist.github.com/jamesmacwhite/58aebfe4a82bb8d645a797a1ba975132 for f in *.rmvb; do ffmpeg -i "$f" -c:a copy -acodec copy "${f%}.

item.title: x11 forwarding on macOS
item.description: Install xQuartz If homebrew installed: brew install --cask xquartz Or install from XQuartz website Restart the machine Enable iglx Euler X11 macOS Euler X11 macOS troubleshooting extra help link defaults write org.macosforge.xquartz.X11 enable_iglx -bool true According to this discussion here, but might not be relevant # check before writing defaults read com.apple.x11 nolisten_tcp defaults read org.X.x11 nolisten_tcp defaults write com.apple.x11 nolisten_tcp -boolean false defaults write org.X.x11 nolisten_tcp -boolean false To validate:

item.title: Sign With GPG
item.description: Motivation Came across this signing in dotfiles and I would also want to have the verified in each commit I made in my pc so why not? How-to Install GPG Suite as it allows storing in macOS keychain, without typing each time brew install --cask gpg-suite Don’t install gpg or pinentry-mac as it might cause conflict and also can not be stored in keychain Create a key either from CLI or in GPG Keychain app Noted the name and email should be the same as the git configure Specify location for git In ~/.

Tools): document.cookie Or you can use EditThisCookie to get cookie of a vip account Get url Copy each episode or follow the guide, grap href using online tools:http://tools.buzzstream.com/link-building-extract-urls It might be easier for a few episodes to just copy and paste

item.title: Test for blog but no emoji in title :(
item.description:
Copied from example site

Test for a single post

created by hugo new post/my-first-post.md

Test for emoji support üòÑ

üòÑ

Not supported in the title yet so one has to edit the layout on the theme stackoverflow, too much trouble…

Math is still not perfect

$$ f(x) = e^x $$

Multiple-line does not render nicely with KaTex now

$$
\begin{align}
y &=& 1+1 \\\\\\
&=& 2
\end{align}
$$

$$
% This works as expected in KaTeX
\begin{aligned}
a &= 1 \\
b &= 2
\end{aligned}
$$

$$ \begin{align} y &=& 1+1 \\\ &=& 2 \end{align} $$

$$ % This works as expected in KaTeX \begin{aligned} a &= 1 \ b &= 2 \end{aligned} $$

ÂõæÁâá

Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Using ETH Cluster
item.description: ‚Äã1. Stay connected with ETH (VPN) See wiki for detailed info. but the bottom line is that you have to stay connected all the time and this can be troublesome in linux or mobile devices. ‚Äã2. Login (SSH) It’s easier to use the ssh key for login on laptop or PC at home (how). Otherwise, you should be able to login with the ETH passwords. 2.1 File transfer See here for details but this should do the job for small files.

item.title: Taichi installation for Apple Silicon
item.description: conda env conda create -n taichi python=3.8 Install Dependencies See best practice using pip in a conda conda activate taichi python3 -m pip install setuptools astor pybind11 pylint # sourceinspect python3 -m pip install pytest pytest-rerunfailures pytest-xdist yapf python3 -m pip install GitPython coverage colorama # autograd # install pypi packages with no whl avaiable for Apple Arm64 python3 -m pip install numpy autograd sourceinspect --compile --pre Build LLVM 10.0.0 from source wget https://github.
